title: Nwada001
author: Nwada001
content: Looking back at how I started on this forum, after registration I left the account for some months with the fear of what to post and what not to post, before I made a move and dropped my first question, which lots of DT members and others helped me clear my fear of, and since then I have been learning day after day in this forum without feeling reluctant about how to post, new technologies, the blockchain in general, and all that.Without much expectation, I was able to see my member rank, which I sometimes believe is difficult to achieve, but I achieved it by just being myself, just as I was advised to be.My first Signature My application was on my Junior Member rank, which I was accepted for, and the pay was supposed to be the project token, but due to not meeting the required post count and other circumstances, I missed the entire two weeks.¬†My 2nd and my first Signature pay is  SellDefi  managed by @Royse777 which the campaign lasted for about 2 weeks, which I fully participated in, after my first week payment, which did not arrive on time but later did after I created a thread regarding a bitcoin deposit that had not arrived, and I learned a lot from the thread too.¬†I am a Bitcoin holder, which I bought on different occasions and for different purposes, and which I am also holding in different wallets.¬†¬†This is my first Bitcoin payment that I have received since learning about crypto. I have received other forms of crypto payment though. I'm just happy about this, and to me, it's worth celebrating.To some degree, I am still a newbie and my learning process is advancing to other levels, especially in the aspect of post quality improvement. @Royse777 never complained about it üòè, but within myself, I know I need to work a little more on these.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: This is not about bitcoin, but about one if the members on this forum, which is you. Move this to reputation board.Nice to see your growing on this forum, this forum is not hard if you are consistent and ready to read and understand what others are posting. I hope you will rank up to full member and then next rank.

comments.author: YOSHIE

comments.body: Congratulations on your first payment when it comes to signature campaigns because it is certainly nice to combine participation in the forum through the acquisition of new knowledge with the possibility of earning something along the way.Quote from: Nwada001 on February 08, 2023, 03:32:19 PMLesson well learned, and such a mistake won't happen next time.When it comes to mistakes, I would like to draw your attention to one very serious thing that I noticed in Meta - and it is that you are accused of word spinning (plagiarism). As far as I can see, your post has been deleted, but you have not received any punishment (so far), and it seems that the moderators had mercy. I hope you will take advantage of this opportunity, because not everyone gets it.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: White pawn on February 08, 2023, 04:02:38 PMBesides the term ‚Äúthird world country‚Äù seems to be derogatory, don‚Äôt you think? I know you mean well(I hope you do). It is, and I'm not even sure which countries fall into that category anymore--but I can't say I haven't used the phrase myself, since it's useful in some cases.¬† I guess if your country's capitol doesn't have massive skyscrapers and a business district, it's a third world country.¬† Eh.OP, congrats on earning some bitcoin but are you using Coinomi for a wallet?¬† That's what it looks like, and I'd probably switch to Electrum if I were you and if you're going to keep it on your smartphone, use a strong password.¬† Those suckers can get stolen or lost in the blink of an eye, and then you're screwed if the person who ends up with it knows what he's doing.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Quote from: Edwardard on February 08, 2023, 01:55:31 PMFrom your recent post history (in local board), I came to know that you are from Nigeria. Its very interesting to have a well english spoken guy from a third world country.A very wrong statement. Did you compliment him or complaint?Is Russia or Japan or even China is 3rd world country? English isn't widely practiced there. I have talked with Japanese whose English was shit. I have talked with Russian who took more than 10 minutes to confirm that he was talking about "catch". English is a language only.Now, if you come to general discussion about English in Nigeria, you will be surprised. It's the official language there though used by the officials mostly.

comments.body: Congrats man.I am not a fan of any kind of paid posting, but this is a great way to make people joining and talking about bitcoin, spreading the word of SN. To many more payments and HODL, we are the elite!

But slowly but surely you are progressing towards a full member. I think there will be no unethical act by you in the forum. You discover or discover something that will start a friendship here and last forever. Maybe the campaign you entered to work on has been closed for two weeks. Wait good keep posting next campaign actually apply there and if selected keep earning again thanks.

Initially I didn't believed that someone can pay money for posting on forum. I realized that's real thing only after I got first BTC to my wallet.Quote from: Edwardard on February 08, 2023, 01:55:31 PMFrom your recent post history (in local board), I came to know that you are from Nigeria. Opposite, try to find someone talking decent English in France or Spain. Probably not easiest task.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: It's encouraging to see users like you, Nwada001, on the forum, working hard not to give up and become better. Your zeal and determination to improve here on the forum has brought you this far. I'm confident you can do better than this. This is an encouragement to other newbies in the forum not to give up and to try to learn, ask questions, and follow the forum's rules and regulations. Congratulations, Nwada001 on your first signature paid campaign, and I hope you achieve even more in the coming months on the forum.
